intro: Centotheca madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar centotheca, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Centotheca madagascariensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
